messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 490
messages.msgSnippet: Just had a thought about this...can one use their proof of homeschooling online? Does anyone know? Ann
messages.messageBody:
Just had a thought about this...can one use their proof of homeschooling online?
Does anyone know?
Ann

MorelFam@... wrote:

 
In a message dated 4/5/00 3:51:26 AM, Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com writes:

<< Did you have to show some kind of ID to get this card?  I was thinking
about making one up on my computer and maybe laminating it.  Do
teacher ID cards have pics on them? Thanks
Kathy >>

not for this one.  they just take your word.  but i have a card from barnes
and noble (do you guys know about their 20% discount for teachers?)  so i
have used that card to get my zany brainy and hollywood video teachers cards.
most places arent too sticky about it.  i dont know about making a card, bc
anyone could do that, so where's the proof?  like if they really wanted
proof, seems like they'd need something more than a homemade card....  ?
good luck.  erin

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Digest Number 490
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 4/5/00 3:51:26 AM, Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 4/5/00 3:51:26 AM, Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com writes:

<< I'm just wondering, have you ever known anyone whom unschooling did not
work for?? Are there any tales of tradgedy? I'm sure there are tales like
that no matter what educational method you choose, I'm just wondering how one
prevents such a tragedy with unschooling. >>

i think this is a good question, bc it can alleviate fears and allow us to
relax. not that there is a formula to follow (tho we all sometimes may wish
for that!) but that there are cases to be avoided. however, even in the
tales of failure, i dont think i would blame it on the unschooling (even in
the case above, i bet there was more to it...) kids can learn in spite of
strange attitudes. tho it sounds like this strange attitude of the mama
could have done some damage, providing that rich environment, and taking them
places, etc couldnt have lead to "failure" i dont believe...
erin
